p.span: Makes a full copy of a Context, including all concepts.
xsCloneContext oldContext [IN oldContainer] [BY oldClass] [SCOPED oldScope] TO newContext [IN newContainer] [BY newClass] [SCOPED newScope]
| xsCloneContext ArrTime IN MyArrTime BY Monday SCOPED private TO ArrTime IN MyArrTime BY Tuesday SCOPED private

Clones the context called 'ArrTime' stored in container "MyArrTime" by class 'Monday' within the scope 'private' TO a context with the same name in the same container in the same scope; but, a different class called 'Tuesday'.
oldContext, oldContainer, oldClass, oldScope, newContext, newContainer, newClass, newScope
The name of the existing context.
The name of the container the existing context is stored.
The name of the class for the existing context.
The scope (private, app, global) where the existing container is stored.
The name of the new Context.
The name of the new container to store the context.
The name of the new class for the new context.
The scope (private, app, global) where the new container is stored.
The context is cloned. See xsRenameContext for details about renaming a context.
